about_the_game:
Visual novel, biopunk, ADV, sci-fi, horror, bio-horror, body-horror, adventure


It doesn't have a name. The locals simply call it the City. Lilies do not bloom here and the sun does not shine. There is no fresh breeze blowing here and you can't hear the birds singing.
Josiah Kaviani, a young mathematician and statistician, starts his journey in this underground maze of cramped streets. He is talented and intelligent, but he has one terrible drawback – he is unbearably alone.
But soon, Josiah will have a fateful encounter that will turn his whole life and make him break the shell he used to live in. A meeting with someone or, perhaps, something that is hidden in such depths that even the horrific City cannot reach them. Something so secret that the very knowledge of it can be deadly. Something truly monstrous.


  • A well-written world that you’ve never met before.
  • A dark and frightening science fiction story based on real study.
  • Complex, adult characters, each with their own motives, aspirations, and skeletons in the closet.
  • A variety of difficult choices that might lead the story to an unexpected end at any time.
  • A full range of endings – from bad to awful.
  • An atmospheric soundtrack specially written for the game – it is blood music.
  • Special art gallery where the player can check their progress.
  • Some of the author's ideas were censored as to be found too dark and cruel...
  • ...but most of them remained.


5-10 hours

reviews:
“The great advantage of Athanasy is not only a detailed lore, but also a stunning visual style combined with a specially written musical accompaniment that sinks deep into your soul.”
Darker online-magazine

“...And what happens here is a really cool biopunk that might remind you of not "1984" but the books by Harry Harrison and Paul Di Filippo, the "The Island" and "Gattaca movies," and the art of David Cronenberg and Hans Giger.”
StopGame
short_description: Deep beneath the surface of the dead Earth, the City, the last refuge of humanity, hides. Engineering genius and efforts of all mankind; a giant structure of steel, concrete, and biopolymers. It keeps the remnants of civilization one step away from total extinction.
